detaileddescription.para: The latency to reserve for resume from STANDBY (usec).
The total latency to reserve for entry to and exit from STANDBY (usec).
The initial delay when waking from STANDBY (usec).
The initial wait time (usec) before checking if RCOSC_LF is stable.
The retry wait time (usec) when checking to see if RCOSC_LF is stable.
The initial wait time (usec) before checking if XOSC_HF is stable.
The retry wait time (usec) when checking to see if XOSC_HF is stable.
The initial wait time (usec) before checking if XOSC_LF is stable.
The retry wait time (usec) when checking to see if XOSC_LF is stable.
Resource ID: PKA Module
Resource ID: UART1
Resource ID: SSI1
Resource ID: SPI1
Resource ID: UART2
Resource ID: UART3
Resource ID: SPI2
Included for compatibility. Please use PowerCC26X2_PERIPH_SPI2
Resource ID: SPI3
Included for compatibility. Please use PowerCC26X2_PERIPH_SPI3
Resource ID: I2C1
The temperature delta in degrees C before the RTC is re-compensated when SCLK_LF is derived from SCLK_HF and SCLK_HF is supplied by HPOSC.
The temperature delta in degrees C before the RTC is re-compensated when SCLK_LF is derived from XOSC_LF
Device woke up from shutdown due to an IO event
Device woke up from noise on the JTAG TCK line
Device reset trggered by software or watchdog timeout
Device woke up due to warm reset event. Usually debugger related.
Device reset due to clock loss
Device reset due to VDDR brownout event
Device reset due to VDDS brownout event
Device reset due to pin reset
Device booted due to power on reset

briefdescription.para: Reasons the device has booted or rebooted.
Enable RTC compensation when SCLK_LF is derived from HPOSC.

detaileddescription.para: Enables automatic compensation for temperature based clock drift of the RTC when SCLK_LF is derived from HPOSC.
It only needs to be called once after the system boots.
This function should only be called when SCLK_LF is configured to be derived from HPOSC.

briefdescription.para: Enable RTC compensation when SCLK_LF is derived from XOSC_LF.

detaileddescription.para: Enables automatic compensation for temperature-based clock drift of the RTC when SCLK_LF is derived from XOSC_LF.
It only needs to be called once after the system boots.
This function should only be called when SCLK_LF is configured to be derived from XOSC_LF.

briefdescription.para: Returns the reason for the most recent reset.

detaileddescription.para: This function releases the latches on all frozen IOs. This function should be called after waking up from shutdown and reconfiguring the IO state so as not to cause glitches.

simplesect.para: Calling this function will clear the reset reason register if it was PowerCC26X2_RESET_SHUTDOWN_IO and cause PowerCC26X2_getResetReason not to return the true reset reason.

detaileddescription.para: The Power header file should be included in an application as follows: #include<ti/drivers/Power.h> #include<ti/drivers/power/PowerCC26X2.h>
Refer to Power.h for a complete description of APIs.
This header file defines the power resources, constraints, events, sleep states and transition latencies for CC26X2.
